modules.description: This module handles slicing and measuring of buffer-like data structures, supporting efficient extraction of sub-buffers and calculating their size. It operates on a type that can represent data as a bigstring, string, or bytes. Useful for processing binary data streams where direct memory manipulation and slicing are required.

This module handles efficient manipulation of byte buffers with offset and length tracking. It provides operations to split, shift, merge, and calculate sizes of buffer segments. Useful for network packet processing or binary data parsing where precise memory views are needed.

This module provides formatting combinators for declarative document layout, enabling operations like line breaks, indentation, and box management using `ppf` output handlers and `order` types to control rendering. It works with buffers, IOVec slices, and byte buffers to serialize structured data while managing margins and line breaks. Use cases include generating human-readable text representations with complex layouts and streaming formatted output efficiently.
